message:
from django.conf import settings
ImportError: No module named conf

I've run into this before.. and I think it had something to do with circular imports or something.. any suggestions on how to chase this down? basically once I go to import a views module, it imports something that 'from django.conf import settings' and all hell breaks loose.
doh! my bad. relative modules are tricky. on of my team members added a django.py file to a util module of ours :)

I thought I could do something like sys.path.remove('.') to stop it from importing from the current dir - but I don't have '.' in sys.path for some reason (or anything else that looks like it's the bad path)
gah, I'm chasing the exact same thing right now
we have a django dir in our project I can't get rid of :(
but I can tell this is the root of the issue because import django;django.__file__ shows it's the wrong django
@zeeg This is pretty much the most concise argument I've seen for absolute path imports.
Thanks @zeeg.. I wasn't aware of the absolute_path import. That's huge.
i refuse to name my modules something like "djangocontrib", but rather something like "contrib.django", so I use it fairly often :)
